intro: Boucerosia forskalii, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by woody, spiny fruits containing edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
